easy.explanation: Rose, tulip, and daisy are flowers; oak is a tree.

medium.explanation: Piano, guitar, and violin are string instruments; trumpet is brass.

hard.explanation: All are surnames of famous painters (Francis Bacon, Chuck Close, Edvard Munch, James Whistler), but Bacon sounds like food making it seem different.

easy.explanation: Mercury, Venus, and Earth are planets; the Sun is a star.

medium.explanation: Harvard, Yale, and Princeton are Ivy League schools; Stanford is not.

hard.explanation: Parishioner starts with PARIS (a capital city); the others end with country names: catwOMAN, maCHINA, pyROMANIA.

easy.explanation: Hammer, screwdriver, and wrench are tools; pencil is a writing instrument.

medium.explanation: Washington, Lincoln, and Jefferson were US presidents; Hamilton was not.

hard.explanation: Steam iron, tire iron, and waffle iron are nouns; 'pump iron' is a verb phrase.

easy.explanation: Carrot, broccoli, and spinach are vegetables; apple is a fruit.

medium.explanation: Mars, Venus, and Jupiter are planets; the Moon is a satellite.

hard.explanation: Petals, plates, and pleats are anagrams of each other; pedals is not.

easy.explanation: Lion, tiger, and bear are mammals; eagle is a bird.

medium.explanation: Gold, silver, and copper are chemical elements; bronze is an alloy.

hard.explanation: Spotlight, Moonlight, and Gaslight won Best Picture Oscars; Limelight did not.

easy.explanation: Soccer, basketball, and tennis are physical sports; chess is a board game.

medium.explanation: Hamlet, Macbeth, and Othello are Shakespeare play titles; Romeo is a character name.

hard.explanation: All are US Cabinet departments, but Justice is the oldest established in 1789; the others were created later.

easy.explanation: Red, blue, and green are colors; square is a shape.

medium.explanation: Spanish, French, and Italian are living Romance languages; Latin is dead.

hard.explanation: 125 (5³), 216 (6³), and 343 (7³) are perfect cubes; 392 is not.

easy.explanation: Cup, plate, and bowl are containers; fork is a utensil.

medium.explanation: Rome, Athens, and Cairo are cities; Amazon is a river.

hard.explanation: Eggs (dozen), jurors (12), and months (12) definitionally come in 12; roses are just commonly sold by the dozen.

easy.explanation: Dog, cat, and hamster are common pets; shark is not.

medium.explanation: 2, 3, and 5 are prime numbers; 9 is composite.

hard.explanation: Baltic, Mediterranean, and Boardwalk are Monopoly properties; Broadway is not on the board.

easy.explanation: January, March, and May are months; Monday is a day of the week.

medium.explanation: Triangle, square, and circle are 2D shapes; cube is 3D.

hard.explanation: All mean vertical support, but 'pole' can also mean endpoint/extremity (North Pole), making the wordplay different.

easy.explanation: Elephant, giraffe, and zebra live in warm climates; penguin lives in cold.

medium.explanation: Physics, Chemistry, and Literature are Nobel Prize categories; Mathematics is not.

hard.explanation: Fantasy, Hero, and Honey are Mariah Carey song titles; Vision is not.

easy.explanation: Milk, water, and juice are liquids; bread is solid.

medium.explanation: A, E, and I are always vowels; Y is sometimes a vowel.

hard.explanation: All are characters in Disney's Aladdin, but Princess is the main love interest while the others are sidekicks.

easy.explanation: Airplane, train, and car require fuel/power; bicycle is human-powered.

medium.explanation: Whale, dolphin, and seal are mammals; shark is a fish.

hard.explanation: Melt, freeze, and condense are phase changes of matter; dissolve is a mixing process.

easy.explanation: Chair, table, and desk are furniture; spoon is cutlery.

medium.explanation: Hydrogen, oxygen, and nitrogen are gases at room temperature; carbon is solid.

hard.explanation: Temperature, angle, and latitude are measured in degrees; altitude is measured in feet/meters.

easy.explanation: Shirt, pants, and jacket are worn on the upper/mid body; shoe is worn on feet.

medium.explanation: All end in '-land', but Ireland has different etymology (Éire + land vs. native '-land').

hard.explanation: All have silent letters, but Island's silent 'S' is unique; others have K, P, and L.

easy.explanation: Apple, banana, and orange are fruits; carrot is a vegetable.

medium.explanation: Solid, liquid, and gas are states of matter; fire is a chemical reaction/phenomenon.

hard.explanation: Overturn, overlook, and overtake can be compound words; overcome is always one word.

easy.explanation: Book, magazine, and newspaper are print media; television is broadcast.

medium.explanation: All are continents, but Australia is also a single country.

hard.explanation: 4 (2²), 9 (3²), and 16 (4²) are perfect squares; 18 is not.

easy.explanation: Guitar, piano, and drums are musical instruments; microphone is audio equipment.

medium.explanation: Copper, iron, and zinc are metals; sand is not.

hard.explanation: All are Oscar Best Animated Feature winners, but Flow won in 2025 while others are older.

easy.explanation: Summer, winter, and spring are seasons; January is a month.

medium.explanation: Argon, radon, and neon are noble gases ending in '-on'; carbon is not.

hard.explanation: All mean 'to heed', but 'mind' has multiple distinct meanings (brain, care for, obey).

easy.explanation: Circle, square, and triangle are shapes; red is a color.

medium.explanation: Dragonfly, firefly, and mayfly are actually flies; butterfly is not.

hard.explanation: 1, 1, 2 are the first three Fibonacci numbers; 4 doesn't follow (should be 3).

easy.explanation: Cow, pig, and chicken are farm animals; lion is wild.

medium.explanation: Oxygen, nitrogen, and helium are gases; mercury is a liquid metal.

hard.explanation: All are things gathered by spies, but 'dirt' is slang while others are formal terms.

easy.explanation: Cat, dog, and bird are land/air animals; fish is aquatic.

medium.explanation: Violin, cello, and bass are string instruments; flute is woodwind.

hard.explanation: Cell, body, and nucleus are prison-related terms; heart is an organ.

easy.explanation: Hot, cold, and warm are temperatures; blue is a color.

medium.explanation: Einstein, Newton, and Darwin were scientists; Picasso was an artist.

hard.explanation: Speak, say, and whisper are verbs; voice is primarily a noun (though can be verbed).

easy.explanation: North, south, and east are cardinal directions; up is vertical.

medium.explanation: King, queen, and bishop are chess pieces; checkmate is a game state.

hard.explanation: RST, DEF, and LMN are consecutive alphabet letters; QRS skips P.

easy.explanation: Pen, pencil, and crayon are used to write/draw; eraser removes marks.

medium.explanation: Saturn, Mars, and Neptune are planets; Sirius is a star.

hard.explanation: All are dog commands, but 'down' has multiple meanings (direction, command, feathers).

easy.explanation: Run, jump, and skip are active movements; sleep is rest.

medium.explanation: I, V, and X are Roman numerals; A is not.

hard.explanation: Grimace (McDonald's), Barney (dinosaur), and Mets (team colors) are purple pop culture references; eggplant is just naturally purple.

easy.explanation: Sun, moon, and stars are celestial bodies; cloud is weather.

medium.explanation: Bucket list, guest list, and wish list are common phrases; shopping list is more mundane.

hard.explanation: All mean 'situated/positioned', but 'left' also means direction or departed.

easy.explanation: Happy, sad, and angry are emotions; table is furniture.

medium.explanation: Soccer, hockey, and cricket are sports; piano is an instrument.

hard.explanation: All mean 'deserved/proper', but 'right' has the most alternate meanings (direction, correct, entitlement).

easy.explanation: Red, blue, and yellow are colors; Tuesday is a day.

medium.explanation: Gold, silver, and copper are metals; quartz is a mineral.

hard.explanation: All are breakfast foods, but Bacon is also a painter's surname (Francis Bacon).

easy.explanation: Walk, run, and jog are ground movements; fly is aerial.

medium.explanation: Tokyo, Paris, and London are cities; Africa is a continent.

hard.explanation: All come in dozens, but 'egg' is the only food item while others are conceptual groups.
